DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare performance CPAP ( continuous positive airway pressure ) device clinical polysomnography ( PSG ) identify breathe event patient obstructive sleep apnea .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Breathing Event Detection CPAP Device Clinical Polysomnography
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 2175 2 . Diagnosis OSAHS baseline AHI ≥ 15 events/hr sleep assess January 01 , 2007 later 3 . CPAP prescription 8cm H20 high 4 . Able willing provide write informed consent 5 . Native English speaker 1 . Participation another interventional research study within last 30 day 2 . Major medical psychiatric condition would interfere demand study adherence PAP . Examples include unstable cardiovascular disease ( Class III / IV CHF ) , neuromuscular disease , cancer , renal failure . 3 . Chronic respiratory failure insufficiency suspect known neuromuscular disease , moderate severe COPD pulmonary disorder , condition elevation arterial carbon dioxide level ( > 45 mmHg ) awake , subject require continuous oxygen therapy . 4 . Surgery upper airway , nose , sinus , middle ear within previous 90 day 5 . Surgery time treatment OSAHS uvulopalatopharyngoplasty ( UPPP ) 6 . Presence untreated poorly manage , nonOSAHS related sleep disorder : 1. moderate severe periodic limb movement ( ≥ 30/hr symptom arousal ) 2. arousal associate periodic limb movement > 10 per hour 3. anyone experience chronic severe insomnia . 7 . Consumption ethanol immediately prior research PSG
